finding: Molecular phylogeny of prokaryotes initiated by Carl Woese using small subunit ribosomal RNA sequences.
SSU rRNA trees have been considered standard tree of life by many biologists.
Controversies arise due to intensive lateral gene transfer among prokaryotes.
Composition vector method based on whole genome data avoids sequence alignment and provides robust phylogenetic results for 139 prokaryotic genomes.
Method has been applied successfully to bacteria, organelles, and a few viruses, and a composition vector tree web server is available.
